intro: Draba megasperma, commonly known as the broadleaf winter cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features basal rosettes of narrow, glaucous leaves and produces small, yellow flowers in early spring. It is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and often grows in disturbed soils or rocky habitats. Draba megasperma is known for its ability to thrive in cold climates and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
